intro: Micropiper alatum, commonly known as the winged piper, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes other species of pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive winged leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes. Micropiper alatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
